title: Bernoullis equation - height and radius changes

content.question: Four tubes each have one section of radius <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> and one section of radius <math alttext="2 r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>r</mi></math>, that are at different heights. Water flows in the tubes, past point <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and then point <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, which are each located in a section of the tube that has a constant radius. The vertical distance between points <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is always <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi></math>. Which of the following figures shows a configuration of the tubes where the pressure at point <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> must be greater than the pressure at point <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> ?

choices.label: The figure shows a tube with three sections and 2 points labeled “X” and “Y.” The tube has a narrow horizontal section on the left with a radius of r and a wide horizontal section on the right with a radius of 2 r. Point Y is in the middle of the wide section on the right. The vertical distance between points X and Y is h.
